postBodyContent:
What would you say if I told you there are three ghosts living in my mom’s studio?
JULIE AND THE PHANTOMS (2020-)

i think we’re hardest on ourselves because sometimes, we believe the lie that no one will ever care about us more than we possibly could.

we try to fill a void that isn’t there yet, so we’re the ones gutting our own hearts to create that deadened space. we take the shovels ourselves and dig a grave for our former selves and we say we’ve been pushed inside, but really we walked right in.

we’re waiting for the Moment when things come together or when a person comes along and changes you and that just. that isn’t life. that isn’t living.

the smallest moments are the ones you take back your worth and you take back your joy. you hit delete on a self-deprecating sentence you typed out. you choose the small combo instead of a large at your favorite fast food restaurant. you treat yourself to something silly and whatever price feels too high for you just because you are allowed to do that every once in a while.

people come in and out of your lives. they’re meant to do that. the only constant you have is yourself.

that doesn’t mean you can’t grow where you’re planted, right in the skin you’re in, with all the shit your brain synapses gets wrong.

idk just. the hardest lesson and the most important one i have learned?

allowing yourself grace. literally holding yourself to a less than perfect standard, because perfection is never going to be within your reach. ever. stop telling yourself you aren’t enough when what you’re really saying is you’re not perfect because no one ever is, no one ever will be, and holy shit imperfection is absolutely the most unifying and beautiful thing about humanity.

you have worth, you have purpose, and you’re allowed to have days where you don’t want any of that, you just wanna lay in bed. that day won’t last forever. you’ll get the motivation back. let yourself rest sometimes.

it’s not a step backwards. it’s just one to the side. it’s still movement. still growth.

love yourself. not because no one else ever will.

love yourself because you’re the one that’ll be able to really get it right.

//

be kind. start with you.

- l. james

I am not the actor who’s going to feed you the grace that you want. Sorry, the way I was raised, if anyone comes talking nonsense I’m going to shut them down. You have to fight fire with fire sometimes. So transfer that “grace and dignity” to someone else. I’m not your role model.

julie molina in every episode

↳ S01E06, FINALLY FREE
DUA LIPA by Theo Wenner  for M Le magazine du Monde March, 2021.
— am i a troubled kid? yeah, you could say that.
I broke the lock. If I concentrate, I can be pretty strong.
